rule: If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must include at least two of those tags concatenated with additional characters, spaces, or punctuation marks.
validityText:
The input is a JSON-like structure with a "sentence" and a "word" key. The sentence "Il joue au football." appears to be grammatically valid and does not contain special characters. The word "football" is present as a substring within the sentence. There are no punctuation marks included in the word. Therefore, the input complies with all specified criteria.
OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output consists of a single word, "NOUN", which could be a valid part-of-speech tag as listed in the description. The output doesn't contain any extraneous information or formatting issues.
OK
